item.title: Ready or Not Trophy/Achievement Guide
item.description:
Ready or Not features 38 achievements in the base game that players will want to complete if they want not only 100% completion, but the beautiful Platinum trophy. As a tactical shooter, Ready or Not can be an addictive, yet punishing experience, so players will want to check in with the entire Ready or Not trophy list found below, which also provides players with the necessary information and tips they need to earn every achievement to prove they're the best officer in Los Suenos.

How to Unlock All Trophies in Ready or Not

Every Ready or Not Trophy & How to Get Them

Achievement/Trophy

Description

How to Complete

Trophy Type

You Were Ready

Unlock all the trophies

Unlock all 38 trophies in the base game

Platinum

Practice Makes Perfect

Complete 'Training'

Training can be accessed under the Singleplayer tab in the Main Menu.

Bronze

Dress to Impress

Unlock all base game customization items

There are around 100 customization options, and they can all be completed by earning an A+ rank and S rank on all missions, but one in particular requires completion of Ironman mode (zero deaths for you and officers).

Bronze

Temperance

Drink one too many coffees

The Debriefing Room in Headquarters has a coffee machine, and players can press a coffee, insert coins, and pour a cup. Drink the cup and repeat 4 to 5 times.

Bronze

The Fool

Be killed by a civilian

Enter 'Valley of the Dolls' and look for Voll's wife, noted for her white dress. Approach her and she will punch you, so let her do this until you die.

Bronze

Who is Pepe Silvia?

On 'A Lethal Obsession' play all of the audiotapes that can be found in the mission

There are multiple audio tapes that can be found. 2 are in the basement, 2 are in the main floor, and 3 are on the upstairs floor.

Bronze

Fool Me Once

On 'Elephant' defuse the second bobm within 2 minutes after defusing the first bomb on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Bring Order to Chaos and then Locate both bombs in 'Elephant' so you can defuse one and immediately run to the other.

Bronze

Fool Me Twice

On 'Relapse' defuse the second bomb within 2 minutes after defusing the first bomb on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Bring Order to Chaos and then Locate both bombs in 'Relapse' so you can defuse one and immediately run to the other.

Bronze

The Devil

Use the secret command for your SWAT team (kill me command)

Kill an innocent civilian and then issue a command to your officers to kill you.

Bronze

The Magician

Arrest a downed suspect only to find out they were faking it

Shoot a suspect in non-lethal areas with a lethal weapon so that they pretend to be dead, then arrest them. It might take a few attempts as suspects can fake being dead, but they cannot fake being incapacitated.

Bronze

First Arrest

Make your first arrest.

This will easily be completed in the first mission, ‘Thank You, Come Again’, as you just need to aim a weapon and issue a command at a suspect to then handcuff and arrest them. It should also work on civilians.

Bronze

Due Process

Incapacitate a suspect with a C2 charge

Use a C2 charge on a door when there is a suspect behind it. Easily done on maps with more enemies, like 'Valley of the Dolls', just use a Mirror Wand to see who's behind the door.

Bronze

Walnut Warrior

Command your squad to breach a door, 20 times

Make your AI squadmates take a Breacher Shotgun or Battering Ram and command them to breach the door 20 times. Valley of the Dolls has a lot of doors.

Bronze

Arrest Warrant

Arrest 50 suspects or civilians

Easily achieved simply by playing the game, as arresting suspects and civilians is the core objective of every mission.

Bronze

What's in the Box?!

Inspect any evidence item from the 'Evidence locker' in the 'Headquarters'

The Evidence Locker is found at the back right of the Headquarters. Simply approach any box and interact with it.

Bronze

Heres's Johnny

Breach 20 locked doors with the 'Battering Ram'

Equip the Battering Ram as your tactical and hit every door you find.

Bronze

Peeping Tom

Use the 'Mirrorgun' 30 times under a door

Equip the Mirror Wand as your tactical and aim it at the bottom of any door 30 times.

Bronze

Say Hello to My Little Friend

Stun enemies with any 'M320' 30 times

Equip the M320 as your tactical and use it to attack 30 suspects.

Bronze

Click From 3, 4 is Binding

Unlock 20 doors using the 'Lockpick Gun'

Equip the Lockpick Gun as a tactical and use it on locked doors.

Bronze

Door Kickers

Have 2 officers with an active “Kicker” trait assigned to the roster and kick a door open in any mission

In single player, hire and use 2 Officer Traits that have 'Kicker' and then have them join you in a mission while you kick a door down.

Bronze

Sillly String

Disarm 10 tripwires

Tripwires are traps, easily found on 'A Lethal Obsession', behind closed doors.

Bronze

The Tactician

Complete a mission without using a weapon and only relying on deployables, tactical gear, and bash on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Enter 'Thank You, Come Again' and rely on Flash Grenades to stun people into submission as there are only 4 suspects.

Bronze

By the Book

Complete a mission while only commanding your officers and not using anything from your loadout on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

'Thank You, Come Again' has the lowest amount of suspects, so simply walk in with heavy armor and use commands to make your Officers put down suspects and make arrests without doing anything else.

Bronze

The War

Complete ‘Thank You, Come Again’, ‘Rust Belt’, and ‘Twisted Nerve’ at C+ on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Complete the 1st, 3rd, and 12th missions on the default Standard difficulty and with a C+, which essentially just means complete the objectives.

Silver

The Decaying City

Complete ‘Elephant’, ‘Relapse’ and ‘Neon Tomb’ at C+ on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Complete the 11th, 14th, and 17th missions on Standard difficulty, focusing purely on objectives to complete the mission and nothing else.

Silver

The Left Behind

Complete ‘Carriers of the Vine’, ‘Sins of the Father’, ‘Ides of March’, and ‘A Lethal Obsession’ at C+ on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Complete the 6th, 13th, and 16th missions on Standard difficulty while achieving the minimum rank required.

Silver

The Abducted

Complete ‘Buy Cheap, Buy Twice', ‘Hide and Seek', 'Ends of the Earth’, and 'Greased Palms’ at C+ on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Complete the 8th, 9th, 15th, and 18th missions.

Silver

The Exploited

Complete ‘The Spider’, ‘Valley of the Dolls’, ‘Sinuous Trail’, and '23 Megabytes a Second' at C+ on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Complete the 2nd, 4th, 7th, and 10th missions.

Silver

The Emperor

Unlock each unique officer trait at least once

There are 12 Officer traits, so if you have yet to have one, fire an Officer to get another.

Silver

The Hanged Man

Complete ‘Hide and Seek' using only a taser, flashbangs, and bash on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Don't use any guns in your loadout, and rely solely on tactical equipment like Tasers and Flashbangs. Use a flashbang and spam the command button to intimidate suspects, and the taser is useful for close range.

Silver

Way Out West

Complete ‘Rust Belt’ using only the .357 Magnum as a weapon on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

The .357 Magnum and Heavy Armor make players an unstoppable death machine, so just execute every suspect.

Silver

Toxic Fumes

Complete 'Twisted Nerve' using only VPL-25, CS gas, gas mask, and bash on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Twisted Nerve is filled with hostiles in a meth den, so a gas mask and CS gas are a great way to clear out hostiles.

Silver

Off Duty

Complete ‘Thank You, Come Again’ without armor and a helmet on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

This is simpler than one thinks, so take a lethal loadout and shoot to kill the 4 suspects.

Silver

Mahogany Masochist

Command your squad to breach a door, 50 times

Make your AI squadmates take a Breacher Shotgun or Battering Ram and command them to breach the door 50 times. Valley of the Dolls has a lot of doors.

Silver

A Rest For the Wicked

Arrest 100 suspects or civilians

Easily achieved simply by playing the game, as arresting suspects and civilians is the core objective of every mission.

Silver

Medal of Valor

Complete all base game missions at S on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Complete all 18 missions with main objectives, soft objectives, evidence secured, no officers downed, and no suspects killed.

Gold

The World

Complete Ready or Not in ‘Ironman mode’ on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Available in Commander Mode for single player, with permadeath, so caution is advised.

Gold

The Hermit

Complete Ready or Not in ‘Ironman mode’ without losing a single officer on 'Standard' difficulty or higher

Available in Commander Mode, leave officers at the entrance of every level to avoid their deaths.

Gold

I'm Too Old For This...

Complete all base game missions on 'Hard' difficulty in any game mode

Start the Hard difficulty and complete all 18 missions, regardless of completion rank.

Gold

Your comment has not been saved

item.title: 11 DC Games With The Best Stories, Ranked
item.description:
Summary

  • Engage in the iconic world of DC through video games with narratives as engaging as comic books.
  • Justice League Heroes offers a straightforward superhero story featuring heroes like Superman and Wonder Woman.
  • The Batman: Arkham series has become a gold standard in the world of superhero games.

Playing as a DC hero or villain is fun, especially with all the powers and technology at their disposal; however, a big part of what makes the DC mythology so interesting is its lore and stories . As technology has advanced, video game developers have found ways to deliver stories for DC’s most iconic characters that are on par or even better than what is seen in films and comics.

From gritty detective mysteries featuring Batman to epic battles with universe-altering stakes with the Justice League, these games immerse players in the iconic world of DC. They offer narratives that are as engaging and thought-provoking as their comic book counterparts, with some games standing out as better than others.

11 Justice League Heroes

A Rare Chance To Play As DC's Iconic Team

Justice League Heroes
Action RPG
Systems
Released
September 10, 2006

WHERE TO PLAY

PHYSICAL

ESRB
T // Fantasy Violence, Mild Language
Powered by

As a dungeon-crawling RPG, Justice League Heroes is effective in providing fans with a straightforward superhero story, where the seven heroes of the Justice League battle a collection of villains. There is a mysterious element to the question of which villain is pulling the strings behind every event, but aside from that, it is a rather basic story that feels like it was pulled out of a comic book, albeit in a good way.

The real appeal to Justice League Heroes is getting to play and level up the abilities of the superheroes. Being able to control characters like Superman, Green Lantern, Wonder Woman, and the Flash is a rarity in video games, and they do not disappoint. It can be compared to other action RPGs, such as Diablo or the Marvel Ultimate Alliance games.

10 Gotham Knights

The Proteges Continue Where Batman Left Off

Gotham Knights
7 /10
7.7 /10
Released
October 21, 2022

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T For Teen // Blood, Language, Use of Alcohol and Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

Gotham Knights separates itself from the Arkhamverse with its more neon-lit Gotham City, unified Bat-Family, twists on Batman lore, and the fact that Batman dies in the first ten minutes of the game. It then follows Batgirl, Nightwing, Red Hood, and Robin as they investigate Batman’s last case, which leads them to the Court of Owls and their plans to control Gotham City from the shadows.

While Gotham Knights wasn’t a major success, it does have its fair share of dedicated fans who play through the story solo or with a partner. Being able to play as one of the four characters or swap between them to play the story however the player wants allows for lots of replayability, especially since each of them has radically different skills, abilities, gear, and perks akin to classes in an RPG.

9 Batman: Arkham Knight

The Final Chapter Is A Memorable But Divisive Entry

Batman: Arkham Knight
9 /10
21
8.5 /10
Released
June 23, 2015

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
M for Mature: Blood, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

On the one hand, Batman: Arkham Knight arguably has the most refined traversal, combat, open-world, and puzzle elements of all the games combined, which makes the player feel like they are playing a Batman simulator. On the other hand, however, the story that Rocksteady tried to end the Batman: Arkham games with is often considered a mixed bag.

Storylines teased in Batman: Arkham City are wasted on tiny side missions, the Batmobile makes certain vehicle encounters less exciting, and the mystery behind the titular Arkham Knight is criticized for being predictable and anticlimactic. However, Batman’s fight against Scarecrow and the Militia has plenty to enjoy, especially with the appearance of a phantom Joker that haunts Batman throughout the game.

8 Injustice: Gods Among Us

Crafted A Dark Multiverse Adventure Before It Was Cool

Injustice: Gods Among Us
8 /10
11
7.4 /10
Released
April 16, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

The idea of Superman turning to the dark side has been explored in comics before, but Injustice: Gods Among Us takes it to another level. It features an alternate DC universe where Superman is tricked into killing his pregnant wife, Lois, which triggers a nuclear explosion that wipes out Metropolis, driving him to become a relentless dictator of Earth.

The dark yet epic storyline is often praised for being on par, if not surpassing, many DC movies. It explores new allegiances with classic heroes and villains swapping roles, heroes from other universes being pulled into the mix, and just how far Superman has fallen. On top of it all, Injustice is a strong fighting game that spawned a franchise thanks to being developed by the team behind the Mortal Kombat series.

7 Batman: Arkham Asylum

Rocksteady Turned A Claustrophobic Nightmare Into An Iconic Superhero Game

Batman: Arkham Asylum
14
9.6 /10
Released
August 25, 2009

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol and Tobacco Reference, Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

It can be said that Batman: Arkham Asylum changed the way people viewed superhero games forever. Instead of cheap, bargain-bin titles and movie tie-ins, they could be AAA action-adventure titles and Game Of The Year material. Rocksteady proved that with their experimental Batman title, which is heavily inspired by famous Batman graphic novels.

Mixing action, detective work, and epic storytelling, Batman: Arkham Asylum has the titular superhero stuck on Arkham Island with a collection of his greatest villains led by the Joker. It’s simplistic in concept, but it has enough layers to it, featuring memorable encounters with Scarecrow, Bane, Poison Ivy, and more to create an iconic game. It also helps that fans were immediately hooked when Kevin Conroy and Mark Hamill reprised their roles as Batman and the Joker, respectively.

6 Injustice 2

Superman's Evil Still Has Its Consequences

Injustice 2
9 /10
12
9.3 /10
Released
May 11, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Language, Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

While the new gear system , which allowed players to create the Superman or Green Arrow of their dreams, and improved gameplay were much-appreciated aspects of Injustice 2 , NetherRealm Studios went bigger with the story. It featured Brainiac coming to Earth in the Injustice universe to collect it and the two remaining vestiges of Krypton: Superman and Supergirl.

Injustice 2 ditches the multiverse elements of the first game's story to focus purely on the aftermath of Superman's fall. With Brainiac and his forces, three factions lead to more characters that flesh out this version of the DC universe even more. The story has even more emotional moments, such as Supergirl struggling with the fact that her cousin is evil, and Batman and Superman reuniting like the best friends they used to be.

5 Batman: The Telltale Series

Troy Baker's Batman Can Be Molded By The Player

Batman: The Telltale Series
9 /10
8.0 /10
Released
August 2, 2016

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
m
Powered by

After playing the character in LEGO form, Batman: The Telltale Series features Troy Baker in the iconic role, portraying a darker and more mature version developed by Telltale Games. As a result, the game is more focused on story and characters, with players choosing how Batman goes about conversations and being Gotham’s hero as new threats emerge.

The Penguin, Catwoman, and a new villain send Batman down a rabbit hole of conspiracies and secrets about Gotham City and even his own family. Troy Baker continues to be a versatile actor in the video game world, but the rest of the cast also excels in voicing their characters, which helps make every twist more engaging. Additionally, players can choose how heroic or dark Batman will be in his adventure, a feature not often seen in Batman games.

4 Batman: The Enemy Within

Leave It To Telltale Games To Top Themselves

Batman: The Enemy Within
Point-and-click
Adventure
Systems
Released
August 8, 2017

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL

ESRB
M // Blood and Gore, Intense Violence, Language
Powered by

If someone enjoyed Batman: The Telltale Series , it only makes sense to immediately hop into Batman: The Enemy Within , which is the second season and a continuation of the story. Gotham has more villains than ever, including Joker, Harley Quinn, Bane, Mr. Freeze, the Riddler, and Amanda Waller, with Bruce dealing with his own struggles on top of it all.

Batman remains fully under the player's control, and with even more plotlines that will leave them conflicted, Batman: The Enemy Within tests players' memory and morals. Like the first game, it also throws in many twists on the lore that fans might not expect, such as Harley Quinn being the more notorious villain, and Batman being friends with the Joker.

3 Batman: Arkham City

The Sequel That Helped Define The Arkhamverse

Batman Arkham City
9 /10
18
9.4 /10
Released
October 18, 2011

WHERE TO PLAY

DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Alcohol Reference, Blood, Mild Language, Suggestive Themes, Use of Tobacco, Violence
Powered by

Less can be more, but Batman: Arkham City proves that bigger can be better, giving players the opportunity to explore an open world as Batman as he is stuck inside a walled-off prison in the heart of Gotham City. With criminals controlling and warring in Arkham City, Warden Hugo Strange is preparing to initiate Protocol 10, leading Batman to try to stop it at all costs.

Not only is the main story grand in scale, but multiple side stories spring from it, including a second campaign starring Catwoman, fleshing out the Arkhamverse in many ways. Most fans consider Arkham City to be the best game in the series, balancing its gameplay with a storyline that pushes Batman to his limits, thanks to the multitude of villains he has to tend to.

2 Batman: Arkham Origins

The Gritty Prequel Became A Cult Classic

Batman: Arkham Origins
8 /10
8.0 /10
Released
October 25, 2013

WHERE TO PLAY

SUBSCRIPTION
DIGITAL
PHYSICAL

ESRB
T for Teen: Blood, Drug Reference, Language, Mild Suggestive Themes, Violence
Powered by

Often regarded as the black sheep of the Batman: Arkham franchise, Batman: Arkham Origins was developed by WB Games Montreal instead of Rocksteady and features a different cast playing the lead characters. Over time, the game has earned a reputation as an iconic prequel, largely due to its engaging story. The narrative takes place during Batman's second year as a vigilante, presenting a more grounded storyline.

It’s Christmas Eve, and eight assassins are after Batman and the fifty-million-dollar bounty on his hea. As Batman: Arkham Origins progresses, WB Games Montreal excels at showing Batman evolve from a street-level vigilante to Gotham’s designated superhero, both physically and emotionally. Roger Craig Smith has since become a beloved Batman voice actor as the game explores Bruce’s rage, heroism, hatred for the Joker, and his relationship with Alfred.

item.title: Rumor: Upcoming Switch 2 Exclusive Will Be a Treat for SRPG Fans
item.description:
Some recently uncovered evidence suggests that Nintendo is working on a new strategy role-playing game for the Switch 2 . The console exclusive may be a new entry in the Fire Emblem series.

The most recent mainline Fire Emblem game, FE Engage , was released in January 2023. Two years later, rumors began circulating about a new installment being in development.

Adding to the recent industry rumblings, YouTuber Doctre81 recently uncovered a LinkedIn profile of a veteran 3D character modeler, who mentions working on a "sequel of [sic] Nintendo's SPRG" for the Switch 2. The page, belonging to one Takeshi Maruyama, doesn't go into any more details, though the limited information that it does provide could still be interpreted as a strong indicator of another Fire Emblem entry being in the works.

Fire Emblem Is Nintendo's Only Major SRPG Franchise

Looking at Nintendo's intellectual property holdings, Fire Emblem is the only major SPRG franchise owned by the Japanese gaming giant. Between that and the fact that another series entry has been rumored to be in development for a while now, that seems to be the likeliest candidate for what the newly spotted LinkedIn profile is referring to. The only other somewhat feasible option is the Wars series, which has been without a new mainline entry since 2008, though it did get revived in 2023 with the Advance Wars 1+2: Re-Boot Camp remakes.

According to Maruyama's LinkedIn profile, he was contracted to work on the mysterious Switch 2-exclusive SRPG between January and April 2025. Four months is a fairly typical length for a temporary 3D character modeler contract in AAA development, especially for experts brought in during a concentrated production window. This suggests that whatever this mysterious project is, it was most likely in active development as of early 2025. Character modeling typically takes place early in full production, following the finalization of design, concept art, and technical constraints. The unannounced Nintendo project was therefore likely past the vertical slice stage and in early-to-mid production as of 2025. Given that modern AAA development cycles typically span at least five years, the game may not be ready to ship for several more years.

However, the timing of character modeling can vary by project, and it's possible Maruyama was brought in later to address specific needs during production. Regardless of the identity of this mysterious project, one recent report claimed that a new Fire Emblem game is planned to be announced sometime in 2025. Based on Nintendo's recent practices, the new entry in the long-running franchise will likely have a short announcement-to-release gap of under a year.

item.title: New Pokemon TCG Plushies Are Perfect for Fans With a Favorite Card
item.description:
The Pokemon Company has announced a new wave of Pokemon plush merchandise, specifically for fans of the franchise’s trading card game. The trading card game, originally licensed to Magic: The Gathering ’s Wizards of the Coast, was a late 90s phenomenon, releasing eight expansion sets between 1998 and 2003. The Pokemon tabletop game has since spawned Pokemon TCG Online and Pokemon TCG Pocket , as digital alternatives.

Of course, the TCG was inspired by Game Freak and Nintendo’s RPG games for the Game Boy, beginning with Pokemon Red and Blue . The latest addition to the video games portfolio will be Pokemon Legends: Z-A , confirmed for an October 16, 2025, release on Nintendo Switch 2. To generate more hype around the upcoming Switch game, the next Pokemon Presents runtime has supposedly been leaked, and fans are hoping the showcase will delve deeper into the succeeding Legends entry.

Announced on Pokemon ’s Japan website, a lineup of Plush Card Stands, Plush Card Multi Bands, and Mascot Coin Holders was unveiled, featuring Pikachu, Eevee, and Mew. Available now to buy at The Pokemon Center, the stands allow fans of the TCG to display their favorite cards, and the coin holders can be attached to backpacks. Finally, the multi bands are designed to organize decks, fix damaged counter cases, and tidy play mats. The announcement comes on the heels of the life-sized Eeveelution plushes becoming available for pre-order, indicating that demand for soft and cuddly Pokemon merchandise is at an all-time high.

Pokemon Plush Card Stands, Coin Holders, and Multi Bands Available Now

  • Pokemon Card Game Plush Card Stand Pikachu - 2,750 yen
  • Pokemon Card Game Plush Card Stand Eevee - 2,750 yen
  • Pokemon Card Game Plush Card Stand Mew - 2,750 yen
  • Pokemon Card Game Mascot Coin Holder Pikachu - 1,980 yen
  • Pokemon Card Game Mascot Coin Holder Eevee - 1,980 yen
  • Pokemon Card Game Mascot Coin Holder Mew - 1,980 yen
  • Pokemon Card Game Plush Card Multi Band Pikachu - 880 yen
  • Pokemon Card Game Plush Card Multi Band Eevee - 880 yen
  • Pokemon Card Game Plush Card Multi Band Mew - 880 yen

Trainers were quick to point out how many stands they would need to display all of their favorite cards, and others noted fans would have fun going about their day while flexing their best card. Since the community is also looking into the plush line’s future, The Pokemon Center is one step ahead by revealing an evolution plush concept, which will allow one plush to transform into certain Pokemon’s evolution stages.

Pokemon TCG Pocket 's July Mass Outbreak event is breaking the mold when it comes to featured Pokemon, and trainers have until July 30 to check it out before the next TCG expansion drops. Following July’s White Flare and Black Bolt, the next expansion in line will be Mega Evolution, which is scheduled to go on sale at the end of September. Featuring over 180 cards, Mega Lucario ex and Mega Gardevoir ex will be front and center in this powerful addition to the TCG catalog.

item.title: Roblox: Peroxide Codes (July 2025)
item.description:
Quick Links

  • All Peroxide Codes
  • How to Redeem Codes in Peroxide
  • How to Get More Peroxide Codes
  • Peroxide Tips and Tricks
  • The Best Roblox Anime Games Like Peroxide

There are plenty of great Roblox games that are inspired by manga and anime, but few, if any, are quite as good as Peroxide . As its name suggests, it's based on Tite Kubo's Bleach and offers players an incredibly enjoyable combat experience that Ichigo himself would be proud of. As in most other Roblox games, that experience can become even better with the help of Peroxide codes.

Players can redeem Peroxide codes to claim a ridiculous amount of free Product Essences, which they can then take to Kisuke in The City to get rerolls on every individual path. Product Essences can also be used to acquire cosmetic items, which is why fans of the game are always on the lookout for all of the latest Peroxide codes.

Updated July 21, 2025, by Tom Bowen: A brand-new Peroxide code was just released. By redeeming 405kLikesFreeSlot , players can get themselves 15 free Product Essences and 1 Free Slot . After doing so, they should take a moment or two to bookmark this page so that they can check back here often, as we're always on the lookout for new codes for Peroxide and will update the list below with any that we find.

How to Redeem Codes in Peroxide

As with similar Roblox games, the process of redeeming codes in Peroxide is relatively straightforward and does not require much knowledge or effort on the player's part. Even so, those having trouble can find step-by-step instructions on how to claim in-game rewards listed below:

  • First, it is necessary to launch Peroxide .
  • Then, if players are entering the game for the first time, they'll need to go through the tutorial.
  • Once the tutorial has been completed, in the upper left part of the screen, players should find and select the start button . It is located to the right of the chat button.
  • In the resulting menu, players should type or paste any of the active Peroxide codes listed above and then press Enter.

How to Get More Peroxide Codes

To get more Peroxide codes, players can subscribe to the developer's official Discord server, where they'll find news and updates about the game. However, the best solution is to bookmark this article, as it is updated every month.

Peroxide Tips and Tricks

Below, players will find some tips and tricks for Peroxide :

Shikai Unlocking

  • Reach level 15 as a Soul Reaper by completing quests on the board.
  • To defeat additional Hollows, visit Wake Up Mundo . It will cost 200 in-game currency.
  • Enhance stats by going to the gym near Kisuke or using agility boards.
  • After reaching level 15, meditate to unlock the Shikai.
  • Achieve B rank to use Shikai infinitely.

Resurrection Unlocking

  • Resurrection is automatically unlocked at level 15.

Use Crystals

  • Collect time relics to purchase crystals, which will enhance abilities.
  • Crystals can grant additional effects to attacks, such as setting enemies on fire.

Optimizing Stat Builds

  • Focus on combat stats rather than support stats.
  • Players need to choose stats based on their desired playstyle, whether it's a strength, vitality, or ability build.
